name: Pyaaz Kachori
history: Pyaaz Kachori, originating from Rajasthan, is a well-loved snack in Indian cuisine. It's particularly famous as a street food and is known for its spicy onion filling.
description: Pyaaz Kachori is a crispy deep-fried pastry filled with a spicy mixture of onions, potatoes, and various spices. It's a flavorful snack often served with chutney.

equipment.name: mixing bowl
equipment.description: For preparing the dough and filling.

ingredients.quantity: for deep frying, plus 2 tablespoons for the dough

instructions.title: Prepare the Dough
instructions.description: Mix all-purpose flour with salt and 2 tablespoons of oil. Add water gradually and knead into a stiff dough. Cover and set aside.

instructions.title: Make the Filling
instructions.description: Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, fennel seeds, and green chilies. Add onions and saut√© until golden. Mix in mashed potatoes, garam masala, red chili powder, amchur, and salt.

instructions.title: Assemble the Kachoris
instructions.description: Divide the dough into small balls. Roll each into a small circle, place a portion of the filling in the center, and seal it. Flatten it slightly to form a kachori.

instructions.title: Deep Fry
instructions.description: Heat oil in a deep pan and fry the kachoris on medium heat until golden brown and crisp.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the hot Pyaaz Kachoris with chutney or ketchup.

tips: Ensure the dough is stiff for the kachoris to be crispy.
Do not overcrowd the pan while frying to maintain even cooking.
variations: Add peas or paneer to the filling for a different flavor.
Experiment with spices like coriander powder or ajwain (carom seeds) in the dough.

storage.shelfLife: Best consumed fresh. Can be stored for 1 day.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container at room temperature.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat in an oven or air fryer for best results.
presentationTips: Serve on a platter garnished with sliced onions and a wedge of lemon.
Pair with a tangy mint or tamarind chutney for added flavor.
